block.p: Holland Elizabeth Jewett, a daughter of Mary R. Jewett and Kent C. Jewett of Summit, N.J., was married there last evening to Brett Michael Hopkins, the son of Joyce A. Hopkins and Charles J. Hopkins of Sinking Spring, Pa. The Rev. Laura R. Matarazzo performed the ceremony at the Calvary Episcopal Church.
The bride and bridegroom met at the University of Richmond, from which they graduated.

Holland Elizabeth Jewett, a daughter of Mary R. Jewett and Kent C. Jewett of Summit, N.J., was married there last evening to Brett Michael Hopkins, the son of Joyce A. Hopkins and Charles J. Hopkins of Sinking Spring, Pa. The Rev. Laura R. Matarazzo performed the ceremony at the Calvary Episcopal Church.

Holland Elizabeth Jewett, a daughter of Mary R. Jewett and Kent C. Jewett of Summit, N.J., was married there last evening to Brett Michael Hopkins, the son of Joyce A. Hopkins and Charles J. Hopkins of Sinking Spring, Pa. The Rev. Laura R. Matarazzo performed the ceremony at the Calvary Episcopal Church.
The bride and bridegroom met at the University of Richmond, from which they graduated.
Mrs. Hopkins, 27, is the assistant to the chairman of the North and South American divisions of Sotheby's, the auction house in New York.
Her father works in New York as a senior vice president in the real estate group of Wells Fargo Bank.

Mr. Hopkins, also 27, works in Stamford, Conn., as an associate portfolio manager in the private portfolio group of Legg Mason, the Baltimore investment management firm. In August, he is to begin studies for an M.B.A. at the University of North Carolina.

His father works in Reading, Pa., as the president and chief executive of the insurance brokerage division of Leesport Financial, a financial services company in Wyomissing, Pa., of which he is a director.
